intro: Gomphrena schlechtendaliana, commonly known as the scarlet globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its spherical, spiky flower heads that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Gomphrena schlechtendaliana is a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
